thread.title: Thunder, lightning and hail: Unsettled weather ahead - Limerick Live
thread.title_full: Thunder, lightning and hail: Unsettled weather ahead - Limerick Live

author: Reporter
title: Thunder, lightning and hail: Unsettled weather ahead - Limerick Live
text: File image Met Éireann have forecast a Friday that might turn wintry, with thunder and a chance of lightning. This Friday will start fresh and increasingly breezy with a mix of sunshine and showers. Showers will mainly affect western and northern areas at first, but will spread across the country during the day on a strong westerly breeze. Some of the showers will be heavy with hail and a slight chance of lightning. Later in the day, showers may turn wintry on high ground. Highest temperatures of 7 to 10 degrees. Fresh & increasingly breezy today with a mix of sunshine and showers️— Met Éireann (@MetEireann) Some of the showers will be heavy with hail and the slight chance of lightning☔️ Highs of 7 to 10C [pic.twitter.com/9M07a7xRDm] [March 22, 2024] A cold and windy Friday night with a mix of clear spells and showers, some of the showers will be heavy and prolonged with hail and thunder possible. Some wintry falls are possible, mainly over the hills. Lowest temperatures of 1 to 4 degrees in fresh to strong westerly winds. A touch of frost is likely in some sheltered spots. Saturday will be a fairly windy day with a mix of sunny spells and showers with the continued chance of hail and thunder. Some wintry falls are possible in the morning on high ground. Highest temperatures of 7 to 10 degrees, but feeling colder.
